sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <kanji>moon</kanji> kanji is made up of the <radical>moon</radical> radical. This kanji is also used to mean <kanji>month</kanji>.
meaningInfo: This should be EZPZ as long as you know the radicals already!
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>moon</kanji> really <reading>gets</reading> (<ja>げつ</ja>) to your <reading>guts</reading> (<ja>がつ</ja>). Staring at the moon for too long will give you terrible indigestion, so be careful!
readingInfo:
Use the <ja>げつ</ja> reading when this kanji means "moon", in words like "moonlight". Use <ja>げつ</ja> for counting months, and saying things like "last month and "next month", too. Go for <ja>がつ</ja> in the names of months, like "January".

Don't worry too much about memorizing this pattern, though. You'll be getting lots of practice soon!
